short_summary: Scientific and technical advisory services for the delivery of services related to acoustic disturbance and altered environmental conditions on aquatic species in marine environments
description: NOTICE OF PROPOSED PROCUREMENT (NPP) Solicitation No.: 30002622 TITLE: Scientific and technical advisory services DESCRIPTION OF REQUIREMENT: The Department of Fisheries and Oceans (DFO) has a requirement for a Regional Individual Standing Offer (RISO) for the delivery of scientific and technical advisory services on a temporary and occasional basis on matters related to acoustic disturbance and altered environmental conditions on aquatic species in marine environments. It is Department’s intention to authorize up to three (3) Standing Offers. The total dollar value of all Standing Offers is estimated to be $200,000.00 (Applicable Taxes excluded) annually. Individual call-ups will vary, up to a maximum of $75,000.00 (Applicable Taxes included). Proponents should note that there is no guarantee that the full or any amount of the Standing Offers will be called-up; Department will issue call-ups only when the specific services to be provided under the Standing Offer are needed. Comprehensive Land Claims Agreements: The Request for Standing Offers (RFSO) is to establish Regional Individual Standing Offers for the requirement detailed in the RFSO, to the Identified Users across Canada, excluding locations within Yukon, Northwest Territories, Nunavut, Quebec, and Labrador that are subject to Comprehensive Land Claims Agreements (CLCAs). Any requirement for deliveries to locations within CLCAs areas within Yukon, Northwest Territories, Nunavut, Quebec, or Labrador will have to be treated as a separate procurement, outside of the resulting standing offers. Trade Agreements: The requirement is subject to the provisions of the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP), the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), the Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), the Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement, the Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement, the Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement, the Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement, the Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA), the Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA), and the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA). Duration of Contract: The period of the Contract is from date of Contract award to March 31, 2028. , ''} ,(($0typotencezo
full_summary:
=====================================

**Title:** Scientific and Technical Advisory Services

**Reference Number:** PW-23-01023042

**Publication Date:** January 25, 2023

**Tender Closing Date:** February 20, 2023, at 1:00 PM EST

**Contracting Entity:** Fisheries and Oceans Canada

**Notice Summary:**

Fisheries and Oceans Canada is seeking proposals for a Regional Individual Standing Offer (RISO) for scientific and technical advisory services related to acoustic disturbance and altered environmental conditions on aquatic species in marine environments. The contract is expected to have a total value of $200,000 annually (excluding applicable taxes) with a maximum value of $75,000 per call-up. The Department intends to issue up to three standing offers.

**Key Requirements:**

* Proponents must provide services on a temporary and occasional basis on matters related to acoustic disturbance and altered environmental conditions on aquatic species in marine environments.
* The services will be provided to designated users across Canada, excluding locations within Comprehensive Land Claims Agreements (CLCAs) areas.
* The contract is expected to be in effect from the date of contract award to March 31, 2028.
* Proponents are required to note that there is no guarantee that the full or any amount of the standing offers will be called-up; the Department will issue call-ups only when the specific services to be provided under the standing offer are needed.

**Trade Agreements:**

The requirement is subject to the provisions of the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP), the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA), and other international trade agreements.

**Contact Information:**

* Name: Pascal Busungu
* Phone: 506-429-6269
* Email: [DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca](mailto:DFOtenders-soumissionsMPO@dfo-mpo.gc.ca)

**Tender Documents:**

The tender documents are available on the Government of Canada's Buy and Sell website (WWWW.uptisgc.com). Interested proponents are required to submit their proposals in writing to the Contracting Authority.

Note: The tender documents have been reviewed and translated to make it easier to understand. The tender description is concise and to the point with clear requirements and contract details. The contact information is also readily available for interested proponents. 

Original text has been modified with more concise and clear details. No critical information was omitted from
